description: Borrowed from Latin cōnstrictus (“compressed, contracted”), past participle of cōnstringō (“to draw or bind together; to compress”). Doublet of constrain.

verbs.description: constrict (third-person singular simple present constricts, present participle constricting, simple past and past participle constricted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To narrow, especially by application of pressure.
(of a snake) To coil around (prey) in order to asphyxiate it.
